intro: Browneopsis puyensis, commonly known as the Puy-en-Velay bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the French Alps. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine pubescence, while its stems are often hairy. It is a relatively rare species, found primarily in specific regions of France.
